website_summaries.verdict: Combines coding with music so kids can express their creativity in different configurations.
pros: Kids can create unique music patterns depending on how they put the pieces together, encouraging creativity within a coding environment
Allows some of the coding blocks from Awbie to be used (but not vice versa)
cons: Doesn’t hold kids’ attention as long as other Osmo games

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’m disappointed. There’s no real challenge or problem solving involved. The kid is supposed to just make up random sequences of moves and share them with the world to get likes. I expected to see some game where the kid had to write a correct program to solve some problem. I also just learned this game almost works with Coding Awbie. But we don’t have the “play” tile. Thinking of returning this.
customer_reviews.author: eattrig

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: This game is fantastic for our daughter. She loves all things music and has a few music apps, but this creates a whole new level of playing. The pieces are very well made, very sturdy. The instructions are simple to follow for the kids. You must have an iPad and a stand to use this game though (sold separately). But now that we have one game and the stand, the stand will work for all the other Osmo Coding games as well.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great way to introduce coding
customer_reviews.text: We got the genius kit last year for Christmas and wanted to add to our collection. Great way to introduce coding. My kids love making their own music while learning to code.
customer_reviews.author: ASM

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Coding Jam and Detective Agency games for Christmas. Kids finally got around to playing with the coding jam and we're having issues. First, there's no actual instructions so we ended up on YouTube. But it won't "read" or accept the pieces. I've downloaded the Osmo apps onto 3 Kindles now, and it's the same issue every time. Under settings, choosing the "detection issue" doesn't give me any information either. Extremely frustrated. We're 2 days past our return window too so we're stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I just don't know if he was really having fun with it but we'll keep trying together
customer_reviews.text: My son is still trying to figure out if he likes this. I see how well he picks up on what they are asking him to do which is a pleasant surprise! I just don't know if he was really having fun with it but we'll keep trying together.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Great product line
customer_reviews.text: Great product for my kids to play together on. They are learning without realizing it and take such pride sending their creations to me over email. I highly recommend all the Osmo products.
customer_reviews.author: McReader

customer_reviews.title: Fun and intuitive
customer_reviews.text: Set up was fairly easy (this is our first Osmo game, so we had to create an account, etc) and the tutorial taught my child quickly how to interact with the game. He’s off creating and also likes seeing what others have created. From the parents’ perspective, appreciate that it has a case to neatly store the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: SF mama

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi needed
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize this is music making coding. Not sure how i missed that. I'm sure my son will like it too. Love ozmos though. They should bold type that wifi is required to get most out of it. Some of us don't have access.
customer_reviews.author: jds

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why my son wanted this thing but it was a waste of money. I look for educational value in the toys I purchase. There was no coding value at all.
customer_reviews.author: Nay

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Box is great for storing.
customer_reviews.text: Great learning game ! Do wish I could get an extra box as the kids already lost the one we got and the pieces get lost without it ....
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: We love Osmo!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this! It’s such a good homeschooling technique to add into the day
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: The kids love it and don’t even know they’re learning.
customer_reviews.text: My 5-y.o. son wanted this one and specifically spent his birthday money on it. He is very mathematically- and engineering-minded, so he gravitated towards this. We have the genius starter kit, Incredibles, and this, and this one is his favorite. The Osmo setup has been self-explanatory and with the parent app, it tells me how many lines of code he has done and the length etc. Very cool idea. Dad is a Computer Programmer, so he is thrilled that he is starting with this.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Educational
customer_reviews.text: This was on sale for a great price during the holidays, so it was an even greater value. My six-year old grandson loves music and loves the ability to create it himself while learning some basic coding skills . You cannot go wrong with Osmo games, and this one is definitely a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Magic Mom

customer_reviews.title: Highly motivating and a great learning experience. It’s not a video game!
customer_reviews.text: Oslo is the ideal answer for my son’s limited screen time. It’s very interactive and highly engaging. I have most of their products now and just love how they encourage learning.
customer_reviews.author: A. M.

customer_reviews.title: Got one for the littles, now I want one for myself
customer_reviews.text: This game could not possibly be more fantastic. What a fun way to introduce kids to the basic concepts of coding & music composition all at once.
customer_reviews.author: B. McSorley

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: This comes with no instructions even when you download the app. For a kid learning coding it would be helpful to explain what you are working towards or some perspective. Unlike most gaming apps this is not intuitive and my kids never want to pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I love Osmo products, they are great for kids. We bought the coding jam set for my son and he can’t get enough of it, what an awesome way to learn about music and coding at the same time. You won’t regret purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive learning system
customer_reviews.text: This was an item we got to add to our child’s Osmo system. We love this system, our child is learning while playing. I’m very impressed with Osmo.
customer_reviews.author: sporter

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved playing with it for the period of time they were interested in making music.
customer_reviews.author: Lia

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this as a Christmas gift for my eleven year old autistic niece who is a computer whiz kid, and it was a BIG hit!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bullard

customer_reviews.title: granddaughter loves this
customer_reviews.text: i bought a couple Osmo games for my granddaughter and she especially loves this one. that's all i need to know.
customer_reviews.author: laurie

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but good
customer_reviews.text: Since the app is free to download, I consider this to be pricey for just the game pieces, however the game is very fun and educational so it is worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: bkdvet

customer_reviews.title: games crash often and never updates or new games
customer_reviews.text: never any updates or new games for the expensive pieces
customer_reviews.author: xmichael

customer_reviews.title: Missing Tile
customer_reviews.text: The product came sealed in the box, so I assumed all tiles were intact. My daughter attempted to play on an Osmo coding app game, but did not have the triangle shaped tile to make it past the second move. It is disappointing to buy additional accessories in order to explore other Osmo games, to still not be able to play.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M Van Dusseldorp

customer_reviews.title: Great learning game
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves this! I love that she is happy while learning coding.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: So-so product, high price
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great but I don’t think it would hold many 6 year olds attention spans.. the company should probably up the suggested age to 12.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: iPhone app no longer works.
customer_reviews.text: So osmo no longer supports the iPhone apps. We have multiple products that my boys love that they were able to play/ use on the iPhone. I just got them coding jam for Christmas. And we can’t use it on the iPhone. It cant see or recognize the tiles. So now I have to spend a min of $250 on the iPad to be able to use it. bad business.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse for Real

customer_reviews.title: Kids Love IT

customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old is a little obsessed with this game. He spends the majority of his allowed screen time crating fun music. He’s always so excited to play us his new creations.

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not coding

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5 year old. He loves it and it really keeps his attention. Gives him something productive to do during his screen time.

customer_reviews.text: very fun and addicting for both kids and adults :) Teaches basic coding logic with a fun music twist. Highly recommend.

customer_reviews.text: This is great for 4 year olds. And it might not be huge on coding but I write code and this is a great foundation for young kids.

customer_reviews.title: Crap.

customer_reviews.text: Osmo keeps my 7 year old engaged and she looks forward to try new things each time she plays.

customer_reviews.text: Best Christmas present ever my daughter age 7 does not want to stop playing and keeps playing to see what new rewards and characters show up!!!!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: My daughter absolutely loved this gift
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loved this gift. She played with it for about 2 hours Christmas Day and has spent a lot of time on it since then. I'm now looking to purchase other products from Osmo!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another great Osmo game
customer_reviews.text: Another great Osmo game. I use this in my classroom and my students love the music with it. They have a lot of choice and options within the game. My students with special needs love the hands on and visual nature of the coding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We Love Osmo
customer_reviews.text: These products are great for kids and teaches kids valuable skills as well. We have the complete set and enjoy the quality of the products as well! If you’ve got young kids, you NEED this!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jen

customer_reviews.title: What we didn’t expect was that the product visibly dirty (greasy finger prints) and full of what looked like ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought the product used so we expected maybe some wear and tear. What we didn’t expect was that the product visibly dirty (greasy finger prints) and full of what looked like pet hairs, inside and out. This is a gift for my daughter who is extremely allergic. Hopefully we can clean and disinfect the items without doing any damage. I will be very hesitant to order something like this used again. As far as this product goes. We love the Osmo. That’s the only reason it’s getting 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Todd A. Ouwin

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Packaging
customer_reviews.text: What were they thinking? The box doesn't line up with the rest of the Osmon line. See that plastic box on top? That's the coding jam. Annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Leticia R. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gift for your little one
customer_reviews.text: This is awsome, nice way start learning to code for kids in a fun way.
customer_reviews.author: Lightning

product_meta.title: Osmo - Coding Jam - Ages 6-12 - Music Creation, Coding & Problem Solving - For iPad or Fire Tablet (Osmo Base Required)
feature_bullets: OSMO IS MAGIC: Fun-filled & award winning learning games that interact with actual hand held pieces & an iPad and/or Fire Tablet, bringing a child's game pieces & actions to life (No WiFi necessary for game play).
AGE & CAPABILITY: Ages 6-12+. Games are designed for beginner to expert levels. OSMO enables the continuation of learning. Track game progress, using child game profiles, on a parent app.
TEACHING: Use coding blocks and create music beats while coding, making your beat come alive, while learning patterns & problem solving (Coding Jam). A great introduction to the concepts of coding.
WHAT'S IN THE BOX: 23 magnetic coding blocks including: walk, jump, grab, loop, sequentials, sleep & multipliers blocks, stackable storage for game pieces & 1 Game App: Coding Jam.

COMPATIBILITY FOR IPAD & FIRE TABLET: Compatible iPads: All iPads except Generation 1, iPad Pro 11-inch and iPad Pro 12.9-inch. The minimum iOS version needed is iOS 9. Compatible Fire Tablets: 7th Generation Fire 7, 7th Generation Fire HD 8, 7th Generation Fire HD10, 8th Generation Fire HD 8, 9th Generation Fire 7, 9th Generation Fire HD 10. Currently not compatible with the new Fire HD8 launched May 2020.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Item model number: Osmo Coding Jam Game (iPad Base required
